intro: Gurania levyana var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth gurania, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
